title: Bug 13725 Revert is much slower than close and reopen in Java editor
description: The report addresses a performance issue where the 'Revert' operation takes significantly more time than the 'Close and Reopen' operation in the Java editor.
OB: When answering 'no' to the 'do you want to save changes' dialog and double-clicking on the file in the navigator to reopen it, it is observed that the 'Revert' operation from the pop-up menu in the editor takes 15 seconds to replace the contents of the window with the original.
EB: The expected behavior is that the 'Revert' operation should not take significantly more time than closing and reopening a file. Reverting the file contents should be equally fast or even faster than the alternative action, as it typically involves fewer steps.
SR: Steps to reproduce the issue are not provided in the bug report. To address this problem, we need to find a way to make the 'Revert' operation in the Java editor more efficient and closer in performance to the 'Close and Reopen' operation.
